US military strikes another Houthi-controlled site after warning ships to avoid parts of Red Sea https://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/us-military-strikes-another-houthi-control-site-after-warning-ships-to-avoid-parts-of-red-sea/3PCVCJ4MYJFY7JORJXURSQXOOE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/us-military-strikes-another-houthi-control-site-after-warning-ships-to-avoid-parts-of-red-sea/3PCVCJ4MYJFY7JORJXURSQXOOE/ Associated Press journalists in Sanaa, Yemen’s capital, heard one loud explosion. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 02:28:34 +0000 This image provided by the UK Ministry of Defence taken on Thursday shows an RAF Typhoon aircraft taking off from RAF Akrotiri in Cyprus, for a mission to strike targets in Yemen. The US and British militaries bombed more than a dozen sites used by the Iranian-backed Houthis in Yemen late on Thursday, in a massive retaliatory strike using warship- and submarine-launched Tomahawk missiles and fighter jets, US officials said. Photo / UK Ministry of Defence via AP
